LanguageData.Gun_SVU.label: SVU
LanguageData.Gun_SVU.description: A more modern version of the SVDm-2 sniper rifle, which uses a bullpup layout to reduce its dimensions. It has a higher rate of fire compared to its "parent" with a smaller weight, while the accuracy of combat at short and medium ranges remains approximately the same. Today it enjoys well-deserved popularity in the troops and among stalkers.

LanguageData.Gun_RPG7u.label: RPG-7u
LanguageData.Gun_RPG7u.description: A grenade launcher from the 1960s, which remained in huge quantities in army warehouses, from where it ended up in the Zone. It is a smooth-bore, single-shot, recoilless launcher equipped with a PGO-7 optical sight with a magnification of 2.7 diopters. Its impressive dimensions and heavy weight make this weapon not very common among stalkers, but due to its enormous destructive power and ease of use, it has found loyal admirers in the Zone.

LanguageData.Gun_Gaussrifle.label: Item 62
LanguageData.Gun_Gaussrifle.description: A super-precise weapon assembled by designers in the Zone. It works almost silently, since energy sources are used for filming, not gunpowder gases. Despite the colossal power of the shot, the Gauss gun has very little recoil. In terms of accuracy and lethal force, it surpasses any classic small arms.

LanguageData.Gun_Gaussrifle_HUNTER.label: Serial gauss gun
LanguageData.Gun_Gaussrifle_HUNTER.description: Product 62, which has undergone major changes. Parts of the artifacts built into the power coils allowed the projectile to accelerate to higher speeds, which had a positive effect on accuracy. Due to the increase in the power of the coils, the charging time of the capacitors was also increased. On the wooden butt is visible the inscription, "Trust no one, except the monolith and your brothers, no one ..."
